thread.title: "Get your pasty out!" Wayne Shaw laps up pie chants from Southampton fans en route to Wembley
thread.title_full: "Get your pasty out!" Wayne Shaw laps up pie chants from Southampton fans en route to Wembley

author: Jon Moody
title: "Get your pasty out!" Wayne Shaw laps up pie chants from Southampton fans en route to Wembley
text:
"Get your pasty out!" Wayne Shaw laps up pie chants from Southampton fans en route to Wembley Shaw was loving the chanting on the bus and looked hungry for more Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Wayne Shaw serenaded with pie songs before EFL Cup final Share this video Get daily     
Wayne Shaw's week just got even more ridiculous. 
The former Sutton United goalkeeper was catapulted into the headlines at the start of the week after being caught eating a pie in the dugout during the club's FA Cup glamour tie against Arsenal. 
After the betting fix storm and intense spotlight being shone on him, Shaw probably just fancied a quiet weekend. 
Fat chance of that happening. Wayne's having a laugh again (Photo: Rex Features) 
Firstly, Sutton were made to rue his absence as they were forced to play an outfield player in goal. 
Now Shaw - who started his football career as a Southampton trainee alongside Alan Shearer - has bagged himself a ticket to their EFL Cup final showdown against Manchester United. 
He joined other Saints fans on a coach to Wembley and didn't keep a low profile - joining in on their pie-jinks at the back of the bus. Make sure you check it out on the video at the top of the page. "Get your pasty out!" (Photo: Twitter) 
Shaw can be seen lapping up fans' chants, with songs such as "It weren't a pie it was a pasty", "Get your pasty out!" and "Pasty's gonna get ya!" getting an airing. 
Brilliantly, the video ends with Shaw getting out a mini pie he's brought along for the journey. Cue the delirious cheers from fans. Good to see Wayne having a laugh again! poll loading Has Wayne Shaw been harshly treated over his pie-eating? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
